intro: Zollikoferia polydichotoma, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb with a basal rosette of leaves and produces clusters of small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant has a fibrous root system and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its compact size and vibrant blooms. The leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
